intro: Stenogyne septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern stenogyne, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and rock outcrops. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
